item.title: About
item.description: I am a data scientist with a PhD in linguistics and vast experience as a researcher cognitive neuroscience and psychometrics. I use state-of-the-art programming, statistical, and machine learning methods to find meaning in data (and make pretty plots). Experience Aug 2021 Data Science Fellow at Science to Data Science Science to Data Science (S2DS) is a highly selective and intensive 5-week program with the aim of facilitating academics to transition into data science.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Journal Publications Freunberger, D., Bylund, E., & Abrahamsson, N. (in press). Is it time to reconsider the ‘gold standard’ paradigm in ERP studies on grammatical processing in a second language? A critical assessment based on qualitative individual differences. To appear in Applied Linguistics. Freunberger, D., & Roehm, D. (2017). The costs of being certain: Brain potential evidence for linguistic pre-activation in sentence processing. Psychophysiology, 54, 824–832.
